intro: Mandevilla grazielae, commonly known as the Graceful Mandevilla, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its vigorous growth and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of bright orange or red blooms during the warm seasons. Its leaves are heart-shaped and glossy, adding to its ornamental appeal. Mandevilla grazielae is often cultivated as a trailing or climbing plant in gardens and containers.
